requirements: High-school diploma for bachelor's; bachelor's degree and two years of relevant work experience for master's; proof of English proficiency.
eligibility: Non-EU/EEA applicants must pay an application fee.

requirements: Proof of sufficient finances and insurance
eligibility: Non-EU/EEA students enrolled in English-taught bachelor's and master's programmes
fee: €800 - €1000 per month for living expenses; €8,000 - €20,000 per year for tuition
benefits: Access to discounts in student restaurants and public transport; eligibility for scholarships

requirements: Each university has its own scholarship options and application process.
benefits: Scholarships and tuition fee waivers may assist you in covering your tuition fees.

requirements: Must finance own living expenses; check university departments for funding guidance.
benefits: No tuition fees for doctoral students; access to various funding opportunities.

requirements: You must have a passport or travel document that is valid for the whole of your stay in the UK. There must be a blank page in your passport for your Standard Visitor visa. You’ll need to provide details of your travel history, accommodation, and financial means.
eligibility: You must meet the eligibility requirements and only do permitted activities. Depending on your nationality, you may not need a visa to visit the UK.
duration: 6 months for Standard Visitor visa; 11 months for medical reasons; 12 months for academics; maximum of 6 months per visit for long-term visas.
fee: £127 for Standard Visitor visa; £220 for medical reasons or academics; £475 for 2-year long-term; £848 for 5-year long-term; £1,059 for 10-year long-term.
benefits: Allows you to visit the UK for tourism, business, or family visits. Long-term visas available for frequent visitors.
